oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider the algebraic properties of Generalized Laguerre Polynomials for negative integral values given by L-n((-1-n-r)) (x) = Sigma(n)(j=0) ((n-j+r)(n-j)) x(j)/j!. For different values of r, this family gives polynomials which of great interest. Improving on the earlier results of Hajir and Sell, we prove that L-n((-1-n-r)) is irreducible and compute its Galois group for r <= 22. Also we prove that L-n((-1-n-r)) is irreducible and its Galois group contains A(n) whenever n > r/1.63e(1.00008r). (C) 2015 Royal Dutch Mathematical Society (KWG). Published by Elsevier B.V.
